title: How to Separate Postage Stamps

steps.headline: Lay a thin piece of paper or a clean handkerchief over the stamps.
Set the iron to hot.
steps.description: Run the hot iron over the paper or handkerchief. Do this quickly and gently. It can be done straight on the ironing bed, as this is easiest.

steps.headline: Remove the paper and carefully tease apart the stamps using stamp tweezers.
steps.description: The stamps should come apart easily. If not, repeat until the stamps come unstuck.

steps.headline: Add the separated stamps to your collection.

text: Lay a thin piece of paper or a clean handkerchief over the stamps.  Set the iron to hot. Run the hot iron over the paper or handkerchief. Do this quickly and gently. It can be done straight on the ironing bed, as this is easiest. Remove the paper and carefully tease apart the stamps using stamp tweezers. The stamps should come apart easily. If not, repeat until the stamps come unstuck. Add the separated stamps to your collection.
